qas.question: When did an investigation occur under school casualties?
When was the official tally of students killed in the earthquake released?
How many students were killed in Xinhua?
How many students were disabled in Xinhua?
What date were the official numbers of students killed in the earthquake released?
Who kept a blog about the school deaths?
What is the total of school children killed?
Where did the Chinese government decide that parents who had lost children could go for free treatment?

context: Details of school casualties had been under non-governmental investigation since <a0_0>December 2008<a0_0/> by volunteers including artist and architect <a5_0>Ai Weiwei<a5_0/>, who had been constantly posting updates on his blog since March 2009. The official tally of students killed in the earthquake was not released until <a1_0><a4_0>May 7, 2009<a4_0/><a1_0/>, almost a year after the earthquake. According to the state-run Xinhua news agency, the earthquake killed <a2_0><a6_0>5,335<a6_0/><a2_0/> students and left another <a3_0><a7_0>546<a7_0/><a3_0/> children disabled. In the aftermath of the earthquake, the Chinese government declared that parents who had lost their only children would get free treatment from <a8_0>fertility clinics<a8_0/> to reverse vasectomies and tubal ligations conducted by family planning authorities.
